title: [BUG] Wrong source identified with jupyter lab

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: priority/important-longterm
labels.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed or may need multiple releases to complete.

body:
### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.

### System information
- **Stock example script provided in MLflow: github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/examples/sklearn_elasticnet_wine/train.ipynb**
- **Windows 10 Enterprise**
- **MLflow installed from source**
- **MLflow version 1.8.0**
- **Python version 3.8.3**
- **jupyterlab version 2.1.4**
- **No npm**
- **Launch cells in train.ipynb from jupyter lab and check the source of the run wether with the UI or the API**

### Describe the problem
The source is REPLACE_WITH_%CONDA_PREFIX%\lib\site-packages\ipykernel_launcher.py. Moreover the Run().data.tags['mlflow.source.type'] is LOCAL and not NOTEBOOK.

### Code to reproduce issue
Copy github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/examples/sklearn_elasticnet_wine/train.ipynb file on your computer
Launch jupyter lab in the same folder
Open train.ipynb
Execute cells of train.ipynb
Check mlflow.get_run('run_id').data.tags


### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [x] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interface 
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, JavaScript, plotting

Language 
- [ ] `language/python`: Python APIs and clients
